snippet: COHEN--Youssef, died March 31, age 68. Generous, caring, irreverent with an infectious laugh. Born in Egypt, raised in Brazil, professor of politics at UPenn and NYU. Renaissance man who spoke five languages and could curse in several more. Avid proponent of death with dignity. Survived by wife Lindsay Wright; son Max; brothers Pierre and Eric and families; cousins and friends around the world. See The New York Times online obituary for details on April 21 memorial and donations. 1/3
lead_paragraph: COHEN--Youssef, died March 31, age 68. Generous, caring, irreverent with an infectious laugh. Born in Egypt, raised in Brazil, professor of politics at UPenn and NYU. Renaissance man who spoke five languages and could curse in several more. Avid proponent of death with dignity. Survived by wife Lindsay Wright; son Max; brothers Pierre and Eric and families; cousins and friends around the world. See The New York Times online obituary for details on April 21 memorial and donations. 1/3
